results.title: Blue Ice
results.creator_credit: Phillip Garth Law, External Affairs and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A record of the 1954 Australian National Antarctic Research Expedition, which relieved the scientific stations at Macquarie and Heard Islands and established a new station at Mawson on MacRobertson Land in Australian Antarctic Territory. The film describes the expedition’s departure from Melbourne in December 1953 and follows its 12,000 mile journey through high seas and pack ice, providing an insight into daily life at the stations and the challenges presented by often-difficult conditions. There is stunning footage of towering icebergs and masses of penguins as well as aerial reconnaissance and surveillance.

results.title: Birds and billabongs
results.creator_credit: Charles P. Mountford and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Records the 1948 Arnhem Land Expedition, sponsored by the national Geographic Society, the Smithsonian Institute of America and the Commonwealth Government. Shows various types of birds found in Arnhem Land including terns, plovers, Burdekin ducks, sharp-tailed sand pipers, geese, royal spoonbills, the snake bird, brolgas, white necked heron, the egret and the lotus bird. The sound track includes actual recordings of bird song.

results.title: The Billiard room
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir, Joe Scully, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Adults Learning”.
Designed to promote group discussion on the problems of the adult learning process in management-staff relations through a discussion between a potential university dropout, his friend and an onlooker. It suggests that not all learning occurs in the classroom. This film should not be screened by itself as a documentary. It does not provide direct information on the process of adult learning. It is a teaching aid which provides a basis for discussion.

results.title: Beyond the pack ice
results.brief_description: Describes life on the inhospitable Antarctic continent. Animal and plant life is sparse but man has established himself. At the Mawson research station intensive study programmes include auroral physics, meteorology and medicine. The four months of daylight are packed with outdoor activities. Shows the annual arrival of the supply ship from Australia and describes some of the emotions of the men on the expedition.

results.brief_description: Wirth’s circus comes to town! The arrival of the circus at Melbourne and their preparations for a performance. Suitable for children 6+ years old.

results.title: Basic riding techniques
results.creator_credit: Tony Hansen, Peter Johnson, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Motorcycle safety”.
Peter Wherrett and Jenny Johnson discuss why a learner should begin on a 250cc bike. Looks at instruments and controls and explains their application and proper usage. Recommends the best clothing and gear to wear for comfort and safety.

results.title: Barrier story
results.creator_credit: Hugh Alexander, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows the city and people of Broken Hill, situated on one of the richest silver, lead and zinc fields in the world. Emphasis is laid on the rapid development of Broken Hill into a modern mining community with all the facilities for pleasant living and recreation. There is wealth and security, social progress and industrial peace in the ‘Barrier City’.

results.title: Australian weekend
results.creator_credit: Rhonda Small and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Indicates some of the ways in which Australians find recreation in their weekends. The people of Sydney go surfing, yachting, hiking, fishing, or playing cricket, bowls or golf during the day, and dance on the foreshores of the harbour at night. Music but no commentary.
